New Records: Shohei Ohtani set a franchise record with his 95th extra-base hit of the season.
Key Match Events: Manny Machado started a game-ending triple play.
Jake Cronenworth hit an early two-run homer.
San Diego Padres clinched a postseason berth with a 4-2 victory.
Dodgers challenged the out call at second base, but the ruling was upheld following a replay review.
Jake Cronenworth threw to first base to get Miguel Rojas and complete a triple play to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado said, 'We’re going to enjoy tonight, enjoy this game, enjoy the celebration, but the job’s not finished yet.'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'Just to get this lead back up to three, it’s really important.'
Roberts also commented, 'We had opportunities and the only run we scored we got gifted from an error. We just couldn’t get a hit with runners in scoring position.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a playoff atmosphere with 50,369 fans in attendance.
Fans chanted 'MVP! MVP!' at Shohei Ohtani while booing Machado and Fernando Tatis Jr.
The Dodgers' magic number remained four to clinch the division title.
The Padres have won four in a row and nine of their last ten games.
